fields.label: Debate Experience

config.description:
0 – No competitions

1 – 1 competition. NSDA/NHSDLC/BP. Model UN and World Scholars Cup do not count.

2 – 2 or more competitions.  4+ rounds Model UN and World Scholars Cup do not count.
config.label: Debate Experience

fields.label: If applicable, tell us about another recent tournament experience? Name of competition? (e.g. NSDA, China BP) What format? (e.g. Public Forum, BP) Topic? (e.g. immigration, nuclear weapons) Awards Recieved? (e.g. top 32, top 16 etc.)

fields.label: 3) Classes. We want to know about your experience in debate and/or public speaking classes. If you have not been to any debate or public speaking classes don’t worry! A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step!

fields.label: Class Experience

config.description:
0 – No previous classes

1 – Simple debate intro class. Less than 4 weeks. Would include summer camp course.

2 – 1 or more significant class experience. More than 4 weeks course.

fields.label: 4) Argumentation.

config.label: 4) Argumentation.

fields.label: Consider this topic: Students should not be forced to study a foreign language in school. Now provide one argument in support. Remember, an argument is a claim supported by reasoning, evidence and examples.

config.label: Consider this topic: Students should not be forced to study a foreign language in school. Now provide one argument in support. Remember, an argument is a claim supported by reasoning, evidence and examples.

fields.label: We want to see how well you can make and argument for and against a given topic. We will give you a debate topic and ask you to develop TWO different arguments to support a topic and TWO different arguments to oppose a topic.

config.label: We want to see how well you can make and argument for and against a given topic. We will give you a debate topic and ask you to develop TWO different arguments to support a topic and TWO different arguments to oppose a topic.

fields.label: Please provide another argument in support, with claim, reasoning, and evidence.

config.label: Please provide another argument in support, with claim, reasoning, and evidence.

fields.label: Remember. Your arguments for each side should be:

config.label: Remember. Your arguments for each side should be:

fields.label: Please provide an argument in opposition to the topic, also with claim, reasoning and evidence/examples.

config.label: Please provide an argument in opposition to the topic, also with claim, reasoning and evidence/examples.

fields.label: RESOLVED: STUDENTS SHOULD NOT BE FORCED TO STUDY A FOREIGN LANGUAGE IN MIDDLE SCHOOL

config.label: RESOLVED: STUDENTS SHOULD NOT BE FORCED TO STUDY A FOREIGN LANGUAGE IN MIDDLE SCHOOL

fields.label: In this space, provide a refutation to the argument. A refutation is a direct response to an opponent's arguments. Try your best to make a specific and direct refutation rather than introducing a new, unrelated argument.

config.label: In this space, provide a refutation to the argument. A refutation is a direct response to an opponent's arguments. Try your best to make a specific and direct refutation rather than introducing a new, unrelated argument.

fields.label: Argument Score

config.description:
0 – Irrelevant, incoherent assertions, not supported with reasoning, evidence or examples.

1 – Relevant, coherent, differentiated, assertions but not every assertion is supported by reasoning, evidence or examples.

2 – Relevant, coherent, differentiated, assertions with supporting  reasoning, evidence or examples.
config.label: Argument Score

fields.label: In the past year there have been several terrorist attacks around the world in cities like Paris, Brussels, New York. What do you think is the best way to eliminate terrorist attacks? Why?

config.label: In the past year there have been several terrorist attacks around the world in cities like Paris, Brussels, New York. What do you think is the best way to eliminate terrorist attacks? Why?

fields.label: 5) Refutation.

config.label: 5) Refutation.

fields.label: What is your assessment of the Donald Trump presidency so far? What do you see as the key successes and failures of the Trump administration so far?

config.label: What is your assessment of the Donald Trump presidency so far? What do you see as the key successes and failures of the Trump administration so far?

fields.label: One of the most challenging and FUN things about debate is that you get are required to respond to what other people are saying and explain why they are wrong. This is called refutation.

config.label: One of the most challenging and FUN things about debate is that you get are required to respond to what other people are saying and explain why they are wrong. This is called refutation.

fields.label: Tensions between the U.S. and North Korea have been escalating. How do you think the international community should handle this situation?

config.label: Tensions between the U.S. and North Korea have been escalating. How do you think the international community should handle this situation?

fields.label: We want to give you a chance here to listen to an argument from a LearningLeaders coach and explain why they are wrong!

config.label: We want to give you a chance here to listen to an argument from a LearningLeaders coach and explain why they are wrong!

fields.label: In the first box you will simply provide a brief summary of the argument made by the coach and in the second box you will provide reasons for why the coach’s argument is wrong. Try to do your best to respond directly to the argument being made.

config.label: In the first box you will simply provide a brief summary of the argument made by the coach and in the second box you will provide reasons for why the coach’s argument is wrong. Try to do your best to respond directly to the argument being made.

fields.label: Watch this video: http://learningleaders.com/placement/

config.label: Watch this video: http://learningleaders.com/placement/

fields.label: Briefly summarize the argument you just heard here:

config.label: Briefly summarize the argument you just heard here:

fields.label: Provide your refutation to the argument here:

config.label: Provide your refutation to the argument here:

fields.label: Refutation Score

config.description:
0 – No summary or inaccurate summary, minimal to no refutation

1 – Simple summary with minimal refutation to the AREI and/or states counterargument rather than refutation.

2 – Accurate summary with direct refutation to the AREI, multiple layers of analysis
config.label: Refutation Score

fields.label: 6) Current Events

config.label: 6) Current Events

fields.label: One of the greatest things about debate is that you learn more about the world around you in the process of preparing for and engaging in debates.

config.label: One of the greatest things about debate is that you learn more about the world around you in the process of preparing for and engaging in debates.

fields.label: We want to get your perspective on important controversies and current events and find out how much you know about the world around you. If you do not know much about current events, it is okay. You will very soon!

config.label: We want to get your perspective on important controversies and current events and find out how much you know about the world around you. If you do not know much about current events, it is okay. You will very soon!

fields.label: First, we want you to imagine that you are organizing a debate competition for your classmates. You get to choose three debate topics that everyone in your school will debate. You want to choose unique topics that reflect current events of today!

config.label: First, we want you to imagine that you are organizing a debate competition for your classmates. You get to choose three debate topics that everyone in your school will debate. You want to choose unique topics that reflect current events of today!

fields.label: *Debate topics are listed as statements that one side supports and another side opposes. For example: Boys and girls should attend separate schools.

config.label: *Debate topics are listed as statements that one side supports and another side opposes. For example: Boys and girls should attend separate schools.

fields.label: What topics would you choose?

config.label: What topics would you choose?

fields.label: Topic 1

config.label: Topic 1

fields.label: Topic 2

config.label: Topic 2

fields.label: Topic 3

config.label: Topic 3

fields.label: First, Donald Trump. Donald Trump shocked the world when he was elected president of the United States last November. He is the oldest man to ever take office and prior to becoming president he had no experience in government.

config.label: First, Donald Trump. Donald Trump shocked the world when he was elected president of the United States last November. He is the oldest man to ever take office and prior to becoming president he had no experience in government.

fields.label: He has now been president for over 100 days. What is your assessment of the Donald Trump presidency? What do you see as the key successes and failures of the Trump administration so far?

config.label: He has now been president for over 100 days. What is your assessment of the Donald Trump presidency? What do you see as the key successes and failures of the Trump administration so far?

fields.label: Second, terrorism. In the past two decades one of the major global threats has been terrorism. Recently, there have been several terrorist attacks around the world in cities like Paris, Brussels, and London.

config.label: Second, terrorism. In the past two decades one of the major global threats has been terrorism. Recently, there have been several terrorist attacks around the world in cities like Paris, Brussels, and London.

fields.label: Many scholars and politicians are busy trying to understand terrorism and why it happened. What do you think is the root cause of terrorism? Why do you think this?

config.label: Many scholars and politicians are busy trying to understand terrorism and why it happened. What do you think is the root cause of terrorism? Why do you think this?

fields.label: Current Events Score

config.description:
0 – No apparent understanding of current events.

1 – Aware of basic awareness of current events but no opinion about or background knowledge of.

2 – Aware, opinionated and knowledgeable about current events.
config.label: Current Events Score

fields.label: You will now be asked to pick a topic. Take 5 minutes to prepare a well organized speech with intro, body, and conclusion. Provide as many details and evidence as you can. Speech should be at least one minute and no more than five minutes.

config.label: You will now be asked to pick a topic. Take 5 minutes to prepare a well organized speech with intro, body, and conclusion. Provide as many details and evidence as you can. Speech should be at least one minute and no more than five minutes.

fields.label: On-Site PS Comments

config.label: On-Site PS Comments

fields.label: Public Speaking Score

config.description:
0 – Unable to give a coherent speech. Less than 30 seconds speaking. Major pronunciation and grammar problems

1 – Language is understood, is able to speak for more than 30 seconds, content is relevant to the question, lacks organization, lacks basic public speaking skills gestures, eye contact, voice inflection.

2 – Language is clearly understood, is able to speak for more than 1 minute, content is relevant and organized, displays some basic public speaking skills gestures, eye contact and voice inflection.
config.label: Public Speaking Score
